featured.text: Nowadays many companies adopt a ______ work schedule which allows their employees to decide when to arrive at work—from as early as 6 a.m. to as late as 11 a.m. (A) relative (B) severe (C) primitive (D) flexible 2.
There never seemed to be enough time to go to church, which disturbed some friends and relatives.
Certain people like to give a name that has been handed down in the family to show 31 for or to remember a relative whom they love or admire.
Feeling that he needed a private space to help him navigate through the 24 , Sasaki positioned a booth where he could “speak” to the dead relative.

definition.en_def: A person connected by blood or marriage; something considered in relation to something else.
definition.example: She invited all her relatives to the family reunion.
